title: Trend Micro Deep Security Agent Manual Scan Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Trend Micro Deep Security Agent. Authentication is required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the Trend Micro Deep Security Notifier service. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Trend Micro has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://success.trendmicro.com/en-US/solution/KA-0018154
timeline:
2024-08-20 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2024-11-19 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2024-11-19 - Advisory Updated
credit: Simon Zuckerbraun - Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative
